Reviews.Title: “chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Job_van_der_Meer
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this new hotel with my daughter and everything was good.I can recommend it. The U-bahn was just around the corner, so very easy. The rooms are small but luxureus and a lot of mirrors, I think ten!! so it looked bigger. The breakfast is great, everything you can imagine and a very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bonsdad
Reviews.Content: This is a very new hotel in the Mitte of Berlin. Everything is shiny, attractive and new. Rooms are on the small side, as are the bathrooms, but again, that is typical of business-oriented hotels in large European cities. I stayed there for 3 nights and liked it very much. The staff is helpful and efficient. The breakfast buffet, although not included in the price, is fabulous! There's free computer/wifi access in the lobby and in the rooms, free flat screen cable tv, and the beds and linen are extremely comfortable. Highly recommend this bustling new hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaNZ89
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Titanic Comfort for 4 nights in February this year. The hotel itself was very clean, modern and nicely decorated. Our room was a little on the small side with little room to maneuver, but this is not unusual in Europe. It was centrally located, most of the major sights in Berlin were within walking distance, ie. Checkpoint Charlie, Museum Island. Sights like Brandenburg Gate and the Reichstag were a little further however if you're not up to walking the distance there is an S-Bahn stop a 1 minute walk from the hotel. The only issue we had was finding somewhere to eat nearby, you have to go a bit further afield to find eateries. All in all a very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money and great location”
Reviews.Author: Petegaff
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night & it ticked all the boxes for an overnight business stay for €45 Positive - Central location, modern and clean and tidy, rooms were well fitted although they were a little on the small size. Great bed and good quality bedding along with the towels. Flat screen tv and free wifi throughout. I had a good nights sleep and all in all it was better than what you expect for the price. The bar area was very pleasant. Negative - No safe in room. Rooms are small. No pool or spa. Parking in the hotel cap park is €20 a day. If you arrive around 18.00 you can pay roadside parking for €2.00 per hour up to 22.00, when it becomes free. The only restriction is that parking charges start again at 09.00 the next day. I would use again on business but would think twice if I was doing a weekend as a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Matthew H
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my wife when we were in Berlin for a conference. The price of the stay was very reasonable. The hotel is very clean, well presented and in a great location for the East of the city. It is also easy enough to reach other parts of the city by tube. The staff all speak excellent English and are very friendly, accommodating and helpful. We arrived late one evening, very hungry. The restaurant was closed, but they offered to make us a sandwich or make a call to a take-out restaurant. We eventually opted for pizza, and they made a call to a local pizza place. The food was delivered to the reception, and the night porter made us cocktails well we waited. The rooms are a little small, but the bed was fine (I'm 6 foot two) and it was clean and well maintained. Next time I am in Berlin I shall be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: juliems
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the complete package. The price we paid was reasonable, the rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff extremely helpful and friendly and speak english. The breakfast is a 'help yourself' continental buffet for 12 euros. We found that the breakfast was so ample that we didn't need to buy lunch. Also the waiting staff were extremely good at clearing dirty dishes and dealing with any requests. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to the Spittlemarket tube station and from here we could access all the tourist attractions. I would definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Bargain for 83 Euros during ITB”
Reviews.Author: Feyenoorder
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised by this property, it is quite plush in its own way, the finishings are all marble and high end stone and provide a lovely ambiance. Check in was efficient and friendly. The rooms are small, I was travelling with colleagues, each with our own room, so it was adequate. Bed was very comfortable, tv was good, no minibar, the bathroom was spotless, I have to give the cleanliness an A+. Breakfast is a Turkish breakfast and it was fresh and adequate, no pork, chicken and turkey items substituted as the hotel is part of a Turkish chain. My only complaint as you can't sign drinks to your room in the bar, it's cash and carry, which is odd for a hotel of this calibre. We elected not to drink there anymore as we might as well hit the millions of bars in Berlin that are everywhere. i see no reason not to stay here next year again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: terrycti
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a completely renovated apartment building with everything nice and new. The location is great near the Spittelmarkt U-Bahn stop. The rooms are all modern, clean and new, contemporary design. My only comment is that the rooms are very small, but that is why the price is so good. Free wifi and breakfast included in the room rate. Fine if you are travelling by yourself for business.

Reviews.Title: “Good relation quality/price.”
Reviews.Author: sylviaFlorence
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very good for its price ( 56 Euro/n), rooms a tiny but clean and nice. The staff is very professional and helpful and you can use their beautiful Apple computers in the hall where there is wi fi all over the place for your iPhones etc. It is also conveniently located near the U-Bahn station Spittelmarkt. The only note: as they do not have refrigerators in the room we bought a bottle mineral water at the hotel bar : 6 Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely small rooms, quite okay for the rest”
Reviews.Author: D W
Reviews.Content: The rooms of the Titanic Hotel are really small. The double beds are tiny, too. It's not really a problem for most people, but if you're taller than 1.75 metres you won't fit in the bed properly. The duvet was also too small for the bed. It isn’t really a big problem to stay here with your partner, but a stay with friends or colleagues might be a bit too cosy because of the small bed. Even though the rooms are small, they are really clean. The furnishing is really modern with Turkish influences. There’s a TV with several German and Turkish channels (and a few English ones, like BBC world) and some radio channels. The breakfast buffet offers a big choice of dishes, both warm (eggs, pancakes, sausages, etc) and cold (yoghurt, bread, toast, cheese, etc). There’s also a variety of juices and fruit available. There’s free wireless internet available, it works quite well downstairs, but the signal in the rooms isn’t very strong. The location is quite good; near an underground station (Spittelmarkt) and at walking distance to many sightseeings in Berlin. We had some problems when we checked in (we had to wait for 20 minutes, even though we already booked and paid the rooms). It could have been a one time thing, because checkout was no problem. When you leave Berlin in the afternoon or evening, you can store your luggage for free after checkout. In conclusion, the rooms (and beds) are extremely small, but for the rest the hotel is quite good.

Reviews.Title: “very good stay”
Reviews.Author: Gianni D
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel; friendly staf, fantastic breakfast, very nice rooms (though a bit small)

Reviews.Title: “Nice central hotel.”
Reviews.Author: emanuelclonda
Reviews.Content: We were for the RHCP concert in Berlin and we booked Titanic because it's 5 minutes walk to Berlin city center. The rooms are quite small but the price/night balances this. The restaurant was closed until 6pm, so if you get up after breakfast time you cannot eat anything in the hotel. Anyway the hotel is quite new and they seemed a little bit working for getting the services in place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: ViviENZ812
Reviews.Content: It's very well located. I stayed at a standard room with my bed. The bed however was a bit small, I think. Space was not large though. Internet connection, I don't know if it's the problem with my laptop- was super slow.... Other than that, it's pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but expensive hotel with small rooms”
Reviews.Author: MisterPerkins
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an average hotel with lobby, lift, restaurant and rooms. The receptionists speak English and German. The breakfasts are expensive (we paid around 12 EUR per person) and did not met my expectations for that price. The room had a nice design but was too small. There were no place for a full-sized wardrobe. And even no place to put your suitcase! The location is near the subway entrance and would be OK only for business trip. I would recommend this hotel to a business-traveler who prefer single accommodation only. If you are a tourist then you'd probably like to find some other place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfy Beds, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: mightymichymac
Reviews.Content: I've recently stayed for 3 nights here for work and would definately recommend it. The location is excellent as it's less than 5 mins walk from Spittelmarkt Station but also less than 30 walk from each of the major attractions. All the staff I interacted with spoke excellent English and a few even managed to decifer my attempt at speaking German! The room itself could have been a little bigger but as I was by myself it wasn't too much of an issue. The bathroom had a lovely double shower and mirrors everywhere! The bed was very soft (which i loved!) and the wardobe was a little awkward to use as it was so tiny. I had three good nights sleep here as the rooms were very quiet. I will definately book this hotel the next time I'm back in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, bad policy”
Reviews.Author: JewelCanada
Reviews.Content: I pre-booked and pre-paid for 4 nights at this hotel, with my travel agent. But my plans changed, and I could only stay 1 night out of 4. I gave them ample notice, but they opted to keep all my money for 4 nights. They said "there's nothing we can do", but ultimately, every hotel has the ability to reimburse a guest for unused nights on a booking. They chose not to. Also, this is the only hotel I've ever been in that does not provide outbound phonelines for guests. You literally cannot call out if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and very good price”
Reviews.Author: manizzle
Reviews.Content: Had a good stay here recently. Nice and close to the station and in a quiet road so no traffic or pedestrian noise. Room not huge but perfect for a short stay. Lovely and clean too! Only down side was my partner could get wifi in the room but I had to go to the foyer to get wifi! Not a major issue just a bit annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Central, clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: claudiopro
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at 15 minutes walking distance from Alexanderplatz, and is close to the Spittelmarkt underground station, which makes it an ideal base for visiting the city. Rooms have a modern design, excellent lighting, and are extremely tidy, clean and quiet – I was at fourth floor, my room faced a closed courtyard. Wi-fi is free but requires authentication. You have to request credentials for the duration of your stay, which must be collected at the reception. Too bad that the wireless network didn't function on the last day, luckily I had checked in for my flight the day before. My room was very small, and there was little space to perform any activity other than walking to the side of the bed. On the other hand, the bed was extremely comfortable and I enjoyed a long and resting sleep. My room also had a flat screen with satellite TV, with numerous German and international channels. A/C was very good, and could be controlled with a handy switch on the wall next to the TV. Quite funny that there was no intercom, I had to get down to the reception for any query. Soap dispensers in the shower didn't function very well, I had to push like fifty times to have a few millilitres of soap. Breakfast was not included, but a buffet breakfast is available for €12.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and experience at the Titanic in Berlin Mitte”
Reviews.Author: Killieken
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 very comfortable nights at the Titanic Comfort Hotel Berlin Mitte. The location was ideal, with Spittelmarkt underground station just around the corner, which ensured that the hotel itself was in a quiet side-street. We had a superior room, which was a good size. The whole hotel seemed very clean, comfortable and well-run. We had dinner there one evening and were well-satisfied with the food and the service. All in all, our stay at the Titanic helped to make our holiday in Berlin a very enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fifer777
Reviews.Content: This is a ideal location for those that are looking to explore the city. Clean and comfy room although very small with no cupboard space, so living out of suitcase. Very quiet location away from the busy roads but the walls are paper thin, and the cleaners are vey noisy! Free Wi-fi was handy. TV - channel 172 to find English movies (20 min adverts are very annoying) breakfast was extra and is the standard continental breakfast at 12 Euro's pp. I would suggest heading out and finding a stall! The large extensive dinner menu consisted of Burger or Pizza. A soft drink will cost more than a beer! Large Lemonade cost 5.40 Euro's which is just plain crazy in my book. Overall it is by far cheapest around and for somewhere to just put your head down for the night, what more do you need?

Reviews.Title: “New, clean and nice !”
Reviews.Author: michaelstrunk
Reviews.Content: New build hotel, ordinary rooms are VERY small. Choose a bigger room ! rooms are clean. Service is very friendly !

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Lincoln L
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, Clean and reasonable price, with telephone n free WiFi (just that my wife's iPhone could get internet access after three second day :( ). Stayed for 3 days. Would consider to come again if visit Berlin in future.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: mojitooo
Reviews.Content: It was nice but short stay in Berlin and this hotel was perfect for that. The hotel is situated just three stops by metro from city center (AlexanderPlatz), so is maximum 20 minutes from the hotel. The hotel is modern furnished at reasonable level to the price which was less than 50 euro per double room. I can recommend this hotel to stay in Belin!

Reviews.Title: “Ryanair Hotel Style in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: janbarnhill
Reviews.Content: After reading all the criticisms in Trip advisor I was nervous, it is small compact inexpensive but This hotel is just fantastic, comfortable clean,for €50 for two people in Berlin Mitte it must be recommended to all, 200m from the U-Bahn you can access all the city .If you want breakfast is extra but top class

Reviews.Title: “Nice tiny hotel room. Good for the price!!!”
Reviews.Author: Newjerseytrekker
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel, but so tiny. The bed was comfortable and it had free wifi. It was a good price and if you are not spending time in your room it is convenient and in a nice area! Heads up...If you eat breakfast (which is quite good), make sure you pay for it when you check out! I paid each day to the waiter and when I checked out they asked me to pay again! I had to open my suitcase and rummage through it in the hotel lobby to find my receipts. They do not keep good account of what is going on. The price and cleanliness is why you stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not like the other Titanic ....”
Reviews.Author: karimari1961
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel, located pretty close to the main attractions of Berlin. The hotel is tastefully decorated and all looks very nice. The staff is friendly but very busy with guests checking in and out, long queues waiting at the reception. Breakfast is well taken care off and you can eat whatever you like. Parking your car is kind of a problem and costs quite a lot of money. The rooms are indeed pretty small, which is no problem if you visit Berlin for a few days and all you do in your room is sleep. Most important thing is that it's a clean room!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: JohnArgento
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights during the Bread & Butter / Premium fair. The check in procedure was extremely slow and terribly inefficient. Full payment was also required up-front at check in. Kind of a strange policy. The absence of any phone or internal intercom system is simply ridiculous. In order to request an iron and ironing board I had to call them with my own mobile (while paying international roaming charges). Same for requesting simple information about how to access the non-working internet connection. When I enquired about whether the problem was being attended to I received a "dont' know' response from the very useless front desk attendant. I informed her that her response was unhelpful and that she should find out and get back to me. She never did. The rooms are also entirely too small for 2 people sharing. I stayed alone but had originally intended to stay as a couple. It would have been impossible. I had a real challenge trying to set up the ironing board to iron my shirt because of the lack of space. It's cute place that looks like it wants to be a hotel, but it's simply failing. Management was not present and the complaints/demands of guests were basically ignored. I will not return and would suggest you stay away as well until they prove otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “If it's the ONLY hotel in Berlin, leave and visit another city!”
Reviews.Author: Grahamc33
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. Brand new hotel, looks great from the outside, but a band aid can't hide the "mountain of wounds" It started with a 45 minute check in as they "couldn't find my name in the computer" although they did have it on a sheet of daily check-ins....? They took the entire 4 night stay payment upfront (that should have been my first warning!) Upon arriving in my double room (702) I was confronted with 2 single beds pushed together and no room to walk down the side of one of them. When I tried to call downstairs to question how two of us were going to stay in this EXTREMELY small room, I was confronted with the biggest surprise in this "business" hotel...... No Phones in the Room!! I don't mind having no phone when you're staying in a small b&b and you're trying to relax, but a business hotel?? Smacks of an un-finished hotel trying to take advantage of the bread and butter show in Berlin!! The internet didn't work for three of the nights that I was there. When I made an international call from my mobile to the reception downstairs to ask as to when it would be working, I was told: "don't know"... Not, we have someone looking at it/ I'll do my best? etc, etc The shower room was a disaster! No hot water in the mornings, and because there is no phone in the room, you can not call downstairs. I certainly wasn't going to walk down from the 7th floor in my towel! The soap dispensers didn't work in the shower or at the basin.... When talking with anyone at the front desk, it was a bother to them and nothing was done. DO NOT STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable and central!”
Reviews.Author: Electric-Emma
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for a short break, and we were very impressed with the polite service, clean rooms and the excellent location of the hotel. It's only a block away from 'Spittelmarkt' tube station, which is only a few stops away from the main attractions in the city. Most impressive was the gorgeous interior which is second to none. Staff were pleasant and nothing was too much trouble. One word of warning: Avoid having a coffee in the downstairs bar as the prices are extortionate, even for hotel standards. Take a stroll down the street and get one from a nearby cafe instead!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Stas911
Reviews.Content: Rooms in perfect condition but extremely small. It's not a problem if you plan only sleeping in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for solo travelers”
Reviews.Author: Johanh83
Reviews.Content: I Stayed here for a few days for a short sightseeing trip of Berlin. For €60 / night I got a clean, neat and comfortable room at a nicely decorated hotel in the center of Berlin. The fact that it's located in the center doesn't mean it's too close to anything noteworthy, however the U-bahn is very conveniently located at just about a two minute walk away and there are hotspots just a few stops away from the U-bahn station near the hotel (such as alexanderplatz or potsdamerplatz). The only downside is the fact that the rooms are small, very small. No problem if you're traveling alone, but two adults with two big suitcases will have a hard time moving around and finding a place to put their stuff. Also one morning there wasn't any hot water, so I had to take a cold shower... but supposedly this was due to a problem outside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new contemporary Hotel with great service in heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Anassim
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife had a pleasurable 2 days stay at Titanic hotel in Berlin. It is a brand new hotel, decorated in a very contemporary style. Rooms are clean, comfortable, small typical of european hotel but very good use of space, comfortable bed and nice shower. Pictures are very good representation of the hotel. Half Block from Metro. Breakfast buffet is well worth the 10Euro. Great Serive at check in, in particular William and Thomas at the front desk who were very friendly and helpful.

HotelInfo.Name: Titanic Comfort Hotel Berlin Mitte
HotelInfo.Address: Elisabeth-Mara-Str. 4, 10117 Berlin, Germany
